author: Special Correspondent
text:
Tuberculosis field workers with the two-wheelers given to them for giving treatment in remote areas in Tirunelveli district.— Photo: A. Shaikmohideen

Collector M. Karunakaran handed over motorcycles worth Rs. 7.80 lakh to 16 senior tuberculosis treatment supervisors so that they can attend to patients in remote areas.

Dr. Karunakaran said the supervisors would ensure regular administration of drugs.

The vehicles were given under National Rural Health Mission.

“Moreover, they will be handy to collect sputum from the patients, get it analysed in the laboratory and commence the right line of treatment,” he said.

District Revenue Officer M.G. Kulandaivel and Deputy Director of Health (TB), Subaer Khan were present.
title: Two-wheelers for TB treatment
